name: West Acre House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Welcoming and friendly hosts, beautiful house and garden. Luxurious room with those little extra touches..... a decanter of sherry, fruit ,toiletries. Would definately stay again if in the area.
reviews.title: highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extra special B&B just 10 to 15 minutes walk outside Alnwick. It will be rare that you find a B&B of this quality. Jeanette and Bruce take honest care and attention. A most peacefull and quiet location.
reviews.title: Extra Special B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a two night birthday treat for my wife as a result of reading the reviews here and I wasn't dissappointed. Everything you read here is true! Fabulous friendly hosts who made our stay even better. We will definitely return.
reviews.title: Real class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful house in a stunning location with views of open countryside. A warm welcome by Bruce & Jeannette set the scene for a lovely 4 night stay, nothing was too much trouble from crystal glasses for our wine to in depth information on local attractions. Our room was of a very high standard with everything you could need for your stay. Breakfast was superb.
reviews.title: Keep it to yourself but West Acre House in Alnwick is the perfect B & B.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at this excellent Guest House and would highly recommend it. Bruce and Jeanette make you feel incredibly welcome and provide for your every need.Great location.
reviews.title: Bruce & Jeanette think of everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at West Acre House. Cannot fault it at all. We stayed in the Oriental Room which was was tastefully decorated and well appointed. West Acre House is beautifully decorated throughout and the Morning Room is fantastic for reading and enjoying tea and cake in the afternoon.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.text: There is ample parking at West Acre and it is about a 10 minute walk into town. I would recommend this guest house if you are looking for somewhere special for a relaxing break. It is simply devine - one of the best I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Plastering heaven :)

likes.disliked: — I had to leave after 1 night because work was complete on the property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like walking, as we do, there are lovely walks from the door and Jeanette and Bruce are keen to advise on the best route to take. They have a good supply of walking books.
reviews.title: Super stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you fancy a treat this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Peaceful Luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: SGM PLASTERING
reviews.title: Perfect honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has to be one of the best B & B places we have stayed in. Beautiful bedrooms, lovely gardens and very friendly owners. One of the benefits is it's closeness to Alnwick Castle and Gardens which are within easy walking distance from Westacre.
reviews.title: Warm and Friendly B & B
To good to believe!
reviews.text: This was our second stay and we will certainly be back again.

reviews.title: A six star B&B
reviews.text: This B&B is really a very good place to stay if you are planning a trip to Alnwick.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was of a very good standard, and the breakfasts were of a very good quality.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay
Wonderful House, Location & Owners
reviews.text: The hosts were very nice people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were met on arrival by Bruce and Jeannette with a pot of tea and home-made cake and shortbread in the conservatory. By the time we were shown up to our room our bags had mysteriously found their way there first. Lovely large room, beautiful decor, well-appointed. The breakfasts were delicious, my grilled sausage tasted wonderful and my husband was thrilled with the locally smoked kippers. We'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Luxurious accommodation, very friendly people, delicious breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is so wonderful that I am tempted to write nothing and keep it all to myself but, in fairness, sharing my views about West Acre House is the right thing to do! My husband and I have stayed with Bruce and Jeanette four times in the past two years whilst researching and realising our retirement plans and every time has been as good as the others. We have slept in two of the four bedrooms on offer and both are exquisite, immaculate, comfortable and offer those extra touches that epitomise Bruce and Jeanette's thoughtful hospitality. I have no doubt that the other two rooms that we haven't stayed in are just the same. Breakfast is the stuff of fantasies. Afternoon and evening tea trays in the garden room are always on offer as is advice and information about local facilities. They have booked restaurant tables on our behalf and even rustled up information about local house prices. They have returned to my home address forgotten items left in a chest of drawers before I had realised they were missing. They had the good grace not to look horrified when we announced we might be neighbours! I recommend West Acre House and the hosts, Bruce and Jeanette, unreservedly. Jane N
reviews.title: This review might jeopardise our future holiday plans!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a fantastic time at West Acre House from our initial warm welcome (and cake and coffee!) through to great advice on the local area, excellent breakfasts and our spacious and well presented room. We were able to visit Craster and the coastline through a very short drive, as well as having Barter Books and Alnwick within 5 minutes walk.
reviews.title: Fantastic welcoming B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a two stay in this lovely country house.
reviews.title: Fantastic country getaway.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were made to feel really special. The accomadation is of a really high standard and there are lots of litte extras too. Bruce and Jeanette are a lovely couple who make you feel really welcome and go out of their way to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.
reviews.title: Perfect Hosts

description: A really beautiful Arts and Crafts influenced Edwardian Villa offering luxury 5 Star accommodation. The house is quietly situated in a leafy suburb on the edge of the lovely town of Alnwick. West Acre House is beautifully maintained and decorated in keeping with the style and ambience of the property. A warm welcome is assured to all of our guests. Our rooms are spacious and nicely appointed with quality furnishings and comfortable beds. Tea and coffee tray is provided. We have the benefit of free off road parking for all of our guests.
